item.title: Help please read!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

Hello everyone, now here’s my problem:
I’d like to make my client connect to my IP, but when I JAR my client, it doesn’t read the Gui.java. So my client can’t connect to my IP.
I’d like to know how to switch over my IP method to client.java

Thanks very much Here’s my Gui method:

[code]private Gui(String args[])
{
super();
try {

		System.out.println("Connecting To The Portal");
		Serverip = "*MY NO-IP*";
		sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));
		initUI();
	} 
	catch(Exception ex)
	{
		ex.printStackTrace();
	}
}[/code]

Now I found something similar in Client.java I’d like to make the above somehow compatible with this:

[code]
public static void main(String args[])
{

        try
	{
            
   
	}
        catch(Exception exception)
        {
            return;
        }
	finally{
            anInt957 = 10;
            anInt958 = 0;
            aBoolean959 = true;
            
   	    try {
            signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());
                }
	    catch(UnknownHostException uhe) {
		return;
	    }
            client client1 = new client();
            client1.method1(503, false, 765);
            return;
	}
      
}[/code]

This is what’s making it connect to LocalHost how do I make it connect to my IP?

Read full topic
